author: Duplicate bentoylight
post_text: January 11, 2017 at 1:28 AM#1HiNiklas Au, on MA-Lighting group on FB, share a nice solution, and for me the most elegant one, to change preset low and high in effects, instead  of merging presetlow and presethigh.here it is :[color=#99FF00]selfix effect 10at effect 10at preset 4.15 /layer=effectlowstore effect 10 /m[/color]You can refer to help/effectlow and other keywords for effects.Enjoy

posts.author: Duplicate bentoylight
posts.post_text: January 11, 2017 at 1:28 AM#1HiNiklas Au, on MA-Lighting group on FB, share a nice solution, and for me the most elegant one, to change preset low and high in effects, instead  of merging presetlow and presethigh.here it is :[color=#99FF00]selfix effect 10at effect 10at preset 4.15 /layer=effectlowstore effect 10 /m[/color]You can refer to help/effectlow and other keywords for effects.Enjoy

posts.post_text: January 11, 2017 at 3:39 AM#2And use BlindEdit if you're worried about doing stuff in your live programmer.

posts.author: VClaiborne
posts.post_text: June 21, 2017 at 7:44 PM#3editing my post.. worked out a way how to make this work for template effects..  seems that I have to add fixtures into the effect and then remove them once I've changed the high/low value.. any other suggestions?

title: Nice workaround to change preset in effect
